intro: Linaria cymbalaria var. minor, commonly known as the lesser throatwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the plant family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces seeds in slender, hairy capsules. Linaria cymbalaria var. minor is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a low-growing herbaceous plant.
